paragraphs.content: A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son.

paragraphs.content: LORD, how are they increased that trouble me! many are they that rise up against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lord, how are they increased that trouble me! many are they that rise up against me.

paragraphs.content: Many there be which say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Many there be which say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.

paragraphs.content: But thou, O LORD, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But thou, O Lord, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.

paragraphs.content: I cried unto the LORD with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I cried unto the Lord with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.

paragraphs.content: I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the LORD sustained me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the Lord sustained me.

paragraphs.content: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set themselves against me round about.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set themselves against me round about.

paragraphs.content: Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Arise, O Lord; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.

paragraphs.content: Salvation belongeth unto the LORD: thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Salvation belongeth unto the Lord: thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.
